question: 撮影
sourceMnemonic: Back in the day, you'd use shadows to photograph things. Now it's all fancy and digital. So, with that in mind, a <kanji>photograph</kanji> <kanji>shadow</kanji> was someone doing a <vocabulary>photoshoot</vocabulary> of some kind. And, in even more modern times, it has become a <vocabulary>movie shoot</vocabulary> as well. More simply, it can be <vocabulary>photographing</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>filming</vocabulary> as well. Basically, if it has to do with taking photos or video, <ja>撮影</ja> is your dude.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
